auto_tag.Description: Signals that the provider should automatically add a tag to all API calls denoting that the resource was created by Terraform

key.Description: API token used to authenticate with the Circonus API

active.Description: If the check is activate or disabled

dimmensions.Description: The dimensions to query for the metric

metric.Description: One or more CloudWatch Metric attributes

namespace.Description: The namespace to pull telemetry from

url.Description: The URL including schema and hostname for the Cloudwatch monitoring server. This value will be used to specify the region - for example, to pull from us-east-1, the URL would be https://monitoring.us-east-1.amazonaws.com.

version.Description: The version of the Cloudwatch API to use.

collector.Description: The collector(s) that are responsible for gathering the metrics

allow_stale.Description: Allow Consul to read from a non-leader system

ca_chain.Description: A path to a file containing all the certificate authorities that should be loaded to validate the remote certificate (for TLS checks)

certificate_file.Description: A path to a file containing the client certificate that will be presented to the remote server (for TLS-enabled checks)

check_blacklist.Description: A blacklist of check names to exclude from metric results

ciphers.Description: A list of ciphers to be used in the TLS protocol (for HTTPS checks)

dc.Description: The Consul datacenter to extract health information from

headers.Description: Map of HTTP Headers to send along with HTTP Requests

http_addr.Description: The HTTP Address of a Consul agent to query

key_file.Description: A path to a file containing key to be used in conjunction with the cilent certificate (for TLS checks)

node.Description: Node Name or NodeID of a Consul agent

node_blacklist.Description: A blacklist of node names or IDs to exclude from metric results

service.Description: Name of the Consul service to check

service_blacklist.Description: A blacklist of service names to exclude from metric results

state.Description: Check for Consul services in this particular state

body_regexp.Description: This regular expression is matched against the body of the response. If a match is not found, the check will be marked as "bad.

ca_chain.Description: A path to a file containing all the certificate authorities that should be loaded to validate the remote certificate (for TLS checks)

certificate_file.Description: A path to a file containing the client certificate that will be presented to the remote server (for TLS-enabled checks)

ciphers.Description: A list of ciphers to be used in the TLS protocol (for HTTPS checks)

code.Description: The HTTP code that is expected. If the code received does not match this regular expression, the check is marked as "bad."

extract.Description: This regular expression is matched against the body of the response globally. The first capturing match is the key and the second capturing match is the value. Each key/value extracted is registered as a metric for the check.

headers.Description: Map of HTTP Headers to send along with HTTP Requests

key_file.Description: A path to a file containing key to be used in conjunction with the cilent certificate (for TLS checks)

payload.Description: The information transferred as the payload of an HTTP request

read_limit.Description: Sets an approximate limit on the data read (0 means no limit)

url.Description: The URL to use as the target of the check

version.Description: Sets the HTTP version for the check to use

async_metrics.Description: Specify whether httptrap metrics are logged immediately or held until the status message is emitted

availability.Description: The percentage of ICMP available required for the check to be considered "good."

count.Description: The number of ICMP requests to send during a single check.

interval.Description: The number of milliseconds between ICMP requests.

ca_chain.Description: A path to a file containing all the certificate authorities that should be loaded to validate the remote certificate (for TLS checks)

certificate_file.Description: A path to a file containing the client certificate that will be presented to the remote server (for TLS-enabled checks)

ciphers.Description: A list of ciphers to be used in the TLS protocol (for HTTPS checks)

headers.Description: Map of HTTP Headers to send along with HTTP Requests

key_file.Description: A path to a file containing key to be used in conjunction with the cilent certificate (for TLS checks)

payload.Description: The information transferred as the payload of an HTTP request

port.Description: Specifies the port on which the management interface can be reached

read_limit.Description: Sets an approximate limit on the data read (0 means no limit)

url.Description: The URL to use as the target of the check

version.Description: Sets the HTTP version for the check to use

metric.Description: Configuration for a stream of metrics

type.Description: Type of metric (e.g. numeric, histogram, text)

unit.Description: The unit of measurement for a metric

metric_limit.Description: Setting a metric_limit will enable all (-1), disable (0), or allow up to the specified limit of metrics for this check ("N+", where N is a positive integer)

dsn.Description: The connect DSN for the MySQL instance

query.Description: The SQL to use as the query

name.Description: The name of the check bundle that will be displayed in the web interface

period.Description: The period between each time the check is made

dsn.Description: The connect DSN for the PostgreSQL instance

query.Description: The SQL to use as the query

source_ip.Description: The source IP of the statsd metrics stream

tags.Description: A list of tags assigned to the check

target.Description: The target of the check (e.g. hostname, URL, IP, etc)

banner_regexp.Description: This regular expression is matched against the response banner. If a match is not found, the check will be marked as bad.

ca_chain.Description: A path to a file containing all the certificate authorities that should be loaded to validate the remote certificate (for TLS checks).

certificate_file.Description: A path to a file containing the client certificate that will be presented to the remote server (for TLS checks).

ciphers.Description: A list of ciphers to be used when establishing a TLS connection

host.Description: Specifies the host name or IP address to connect to for this TCP check

key_file.Description: A path to a file containing key to be used in conjunction with the cilent certificate (for TLS checks)

port.Description: Specifies the port on which the management interface can be reached.

tls.Description: Upgrade TCP connection to use TLS.

timeout.Description: The length of time in seconds (and fractions of a second) before the check will timeout if no response is returned to the collector

username.Description: Username Slackbot uses in Slack to deliver a notification

line_style.Description: How the line should change between point. A string containing either 'stepped', 'interpolated' or null.

type.Description: Type of metric (e.g. numeric, histogram, text)

unit.Description: The unit of measurement for a metric

description.Description: A description of the metric cluster

name.Description: The name of the metric cluster

definition.Description: A query to select a collection of metric streams

type.Description: The operation to perform on the matching metric streams

tags.Description: A list of tags assigned to the metric cluster

check.Description: The CID of the check that contains the metric for this rule set

if.Description: A rule to execute for this rule set

then.Description: Description of the action(s) to take when this rule set is active

after.Description: The length of time we should wait before contacting the contact groups after this ruleset has faulted.

notify.Description: List of contact groups to notify at the following appropriate severity if this rule set is active.

severity.Description: Send a notification at this severity level.

value.Description: Predicate that the rule set uses to evaluate a stream of metrics

absent.Description: Fire the rule set if there has been no data for the given metric stream over the last duration

changed.Description: Boolean indicating the value has changed

contains.Description: Fire the rule set if the text metric contain the following string

match.Description: Fire the rule set if the text metric exactly match the following string

max_value.Description: Fire the rule set if the numeric value is more than the specified value

min_value.Description: Fire the rule set if the numeric value less than the specified value

not_contain.Description: Fire the rule set if the text metric does not contain the following string

not_match.Description: Fire the rule set if the text metric not match the following string

over.Description: Use a derived value using a window

last.Description: Duration over which data from the last interval is examined

using.Description: Define the window funciton to use over the last duration

link.Description: URL to show users when this rule set is active (e.g. wiki)

metric_name.Description: The name of the metric stream within a check to register the rule set with

metric_type.Description: The type of data flowing through the specified metric stream

parent.Description: Parent CID that must be healthy for this rule set to be active

tags.Description: Tags associated with this rule set

invites.Description: Outstanding invites attached to the account

details.Description: Details associated with individual collectors (a.k.a. broker)
